banner.mainContent: Don't miss out! Be one of the first to see our powerful new talks.

fields.title: TED Tech Jun 12 Tablet Portrait Talks (3)
TED Tech Jun 12 Tablet Landscape Talks (5)

videoData.title: Demystifying the wild world of crypto

recItems.blurb: It's incredible that such an amazing technological feat was described in just nine pages. Don't be scared by the math. Even without those parts, you can grasp the basics of the original crypto asset.
recItems.headline: "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System"
recItems.label: READ_ARTICLE

recItems.blurb: Although this book is a few years old, it is still a clear, valuable explainer on all the basics of crypto assets
recItems.headline: *Cryptoassets*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK
recItems.note:
Chris Burniske and Jack Tatar
McGraw Hill, 2017

recItems.blurb: Here's an article I wrote on the basic crypto concepts and terms you're most likely to hear.
recItems.headline: "Interested in Crypto? Here Are 10 Essential Terms You Need to Know"
recItems.label: READ_ARTICLE

recItems.blurb: My book focuses on the history of Ethereum, but to understand crypto, it's important to know the origins of Bitcoin. Nathaniel Popper's book *Digital Gold* is a fun and engaging chronicle of how this coin, born of the cypherpunk movement, grabbed the imaginations of Silicon Valley and gained adoption on the wider world.
recItems.headline: *Digital Gold: Bitcoin and the Inside Story of the Misfits and Millionaires Trying to Reinvent Money*
recItems.label: READ_BOOK

takeAction.blurb: **Open a crypto wallet:** Learn how crypto works. Open a wallet, put in an amount of money you're willing to lose and educate yourself by doing. Try making a payment, exchanging for another crypto, minting an NFT, buying or selling an NFT, voting in a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) or participating in decentralized finance (DeFi) by using a decentralized exchange or a decentralized borrowing and lending protocol.
**Learn how to keep your crypto secure:** Since crypto acts like cash, you can easily lose it or have it stolen from you. Make sure you learn the ins and outs of keeping your money safe.

learnModules.author: Laura Shin
learnModules.headline: *The Cryptopians: Idealism, Greed, Lies, and the Making of the First Big Cryptocurrency Craze*

learnModules.blurb: TED Members help us meet our goal as a non-profit to spread bright ideas around the world. And they get to enjoy access to special events. Join us and support TED.
learnModules.headline: TED Membership: We couldn't do what we do without YOU

nodes.whoTheyAre: Laura Shin covers big ideas from the world of blockchain and cyrptocurrency.
nodes.whyListen: Laura Shin is a crypto journalist, host of the Unchained podcast and newsletter and author of The Cryptopians: Idealism, Greed, Lies, and the Making of the First Big Cryptocurrency Craze. Formerly a senior editor at Forbes, she was the first mainstream journalist to cover crypto full-time.

videoData.description: Is crypto truly the next big thing, or is it just a money-sucking flash in the pan? In a wide-ranging interview, journalist Laura Shin explains what crypto is (and what it definitely isn't), taking us through the most recent turns in its constantly evolving story -- including the recent meltdown caused by the bankruptcy of FTX. (This conversation, hosted by TED tech curator Simone Ross, was part of an exclusive TED Membership event on November 30, 2022. Visit ted.com/membership to become a TED Member.)
